intro: Paullinia carpopodea f. subcalva, commonly known as the Brazilian cherry or pitanga, is a species of flowering plant in the Sapindaceae family. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant produces bright red, fleshy berries that are edible and contain a single seed. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a popular ornamental and fruit-bearing plant in horticulture.
